text: My name is Tyler J. Cox.

I'm the Chief Information Security Officer
for MasterControl.

MasterControl is a unique SAAS company
that provides a solution

that allows regulated companies
to go to market faster.
So if you think about all

the pharmaceuticals, the life sciences,
all of the medical device companies,

they need a solution like ours
to get their product out to market fast.
AWS is our largest technology partner.
In our recent FedRAMP journey,

the AWS Security Assistance Services
provided a baseline and a roadmap

that's allowing us to achieve our FedRAMP
moderate ATO by the end of the year.

They figured out where we were
in that point in time

and then they built a map to show us
where we needed to go.

That allowed my teams
to digest and follow that path.

And it really helped me
as a security leader to see where we were

so that we understood where to allocate
and invest resources
to get where we needed to go.
In 2023, with our FedRAMP project,

we had the opportunity to consolidate
five security tools into three,

which showed  a net savings of $750,000
over three years.

We were able to increase our time to value
and complete our project on time
without budget overruns.

As we've invested in security,
it's opened new business opportunities.

It's impacted our top line revenue
because we're able to shorten

the sales cycle, weâ€™ve increased 
confidence with our customer base.

I think it all starts with the people
because we don't have infinite resources.

We need to catch problems as soon as
possible. AWS has been right there with us.
They help us train our developers

and our platform teams
and stay abreast of the latest threats

allowing us to build gates and proactive
security measures into our SDLC.

This gives us the best chance
of keeping ahead of threats,

and it also allows us to ensure
that we're not spending too much money,

because we all know that it costs
more to fix things after it's released.
It's important that our customers realize

that security is part of 
the DNA of our product
and not an add on.
